channel.title: ::pickup probelm using Jordiescape =P
channel.description:
Well i finally got the server running and tryed to use the pickup command ::pickup 995 10 used something like that forgot which numbers though. Anyways, I tryed to put another ::pickup code by looking around using the search button I've put in so many and all got the same error:
client.java:13049: illegal start of expression public void fromBank<int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount> { ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .
Looks exactly like that. No clue what this means and whys its pointing at the p in public lo ;D Well any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.
Oh sorry forgot to say. I got this error after i tryed to Compile it

item.title: ::pickup probelm using Jordiescape =P
item.dc:creator: @jeremie9299 jeremie9299
item.description:
@jeremie9299 wrote:

k thanks. I’ll try it right now.
And yeah if you mean if you need silabs to play than yeah.

Aw doesn’t work.
Still get the same error after compiling

client.java:13049: illegal start of expression
public void fromBank<int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount> {
^
1 error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 15, 2007, 04:19:44 PM[/size][hr]Problem solved=D
yay thanks ass woop and to others that helped out.
Needed to add a 0 before the item id ^^
Wow just one little 0…
well thanks again.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pickup probelm using Jordiescape =P
item.dc:creator: @Mackrack360_Racer_D Mackrack360 + Racer D
item.description:
@Mackrack360_Racer_D wrote:

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("yournamehere") || playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 10000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10"); }

and if its for silab i believe its

else if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("yournamehere") || playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12)); if (/*newItemID <= 20000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10"); }
